dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque c Ahmed Shehzad b Saeed Ajmal 100 (132b 6x4 4x6 156m) SR: 75.75

dismissalComment.html: Charges down the track and he's holed out at deep midwicket! Hasn't picked the doosra as he was looking to up the ante. Goes down the track and hacks this away, but doesn't get any timing on this.

dismissalText.commentary: Imrul Kayes c †Umar Akmal b Mohammad Talha 59 (75b 5x4 2x6 112m) SR: 78.66

dismissalComment.html: takes his time, shakes his head and then gives it! Umpire Cloete, you legend! This was the slower short ball and it deceived a charging Kayes. He tries to adjust and checks his pull shot, but Pakistan finally have a wicket. Went off the back of the bat and then off the shoulder through to the keeper

dismissalText.commentary: Ahmed Shehzad b Abdur Razzak 103 (123b 12x4 1x6 152m) SR: 83.73

dismissalComment.html: makes room outside leg and he's yorked himself! Anamul Haque lets out a war-cry, Mirpur has woken up! Razzak though looks thoroughly disenchanted with the emotion after bowling a beauty! he's seen the batsman moving in his crease and fires in a middle stump yorker. Shehzad tries to jam a horizontal bat down in time to stop it, but does not succeed

dismissalText.commentary: Fawad Alam run out (†Anamul Haque/Al-Amin Hossain) 74 (70b 4x4 2x6 130m) SR: 105.71

dismissalComment.html: 137 kph, Alam was backing away and the bowler bowls it short and slides it across him. Looks to ramp it over third man but doesn't connect. The keeper dribbles the ball through and the bowler breaks the stumps at the other end. There was lots of height on that bouncer though, very close to being a wide

it was on the cards. Pakistan were piling too much pressure on themselves and Hafeez goes for a slog-sweep against the spin. But all he manages is a slice to long-on. Tight lines from Mominul as he attacks middle and leg, Hafeez had planted his front leg out of the way and swings, but doesn't make good enough contact

two wickets in two overs, Mirpur has gone haywire and that's nothing compared to what the Bangladesh players are feeling! Amid all that, Maqsood has not touched this ball! This quicker delivery just outside off bounces and turns a bit too much for the cut shot and beats him completely. The keeper goes up straight away and Umpire Llong agrees. Maqsood just has a wry smile on his face as he takes it on the chin and walks off

Misbah's gone! Goes for an almighty heave over midwicket and he has been cleaned up. Bangladesh are ecstatic. What a good move by Mushi to bring back his strike bowler and Shakib does not disappoint. This is a skidder tossed up on off stump and Misbah has played all around it

dismissalText.commentary: Abdur Rehman c Ziaur Rahman b Mahmudullah 8 (8b 0x4 0x6 12m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: holes out to long-on as he goes for a slog down the ground. There was too much with on this, plus it was turning away as well. This was always a poor choice of shot and he succumbs. Might actually be good for Pakistan that that experiment ended sooner than later

dismissalText.commentary: Shahid Afridi run out (Shakib Al Hasan) 59 (25b 2x4 7x6 34m) SR: 236

dismissalComment.html: very full outside off, he is forward and drills this to mid-off. They set off for the single, even with Afridi struggling to move out there. A direct hit from mid-off finds him short and Mirpur roars

commentPreTextItems.html: Two of two as Alam receives handshakes in the dressing room. Akmal on strike

commentTextItems.html: slogged to the midwicket boundary and Pakistan complete their biggest chase in Pakistan history to seal a spot in the Asia Cup final! It was length, it had room outside off and it was banished

commentPostTextItems.html: 10.15 pm Phew, another nail-biter in this Asia Cup. It's been some amazing fun, but for now we'll have to say goodbye. We know our finalists now. It will be Sri Lanka v Pakistan on Saturday. But there are a few other formalities to get done with. The first is India v Afghanistan tomorrow. Do join us then. This is Alagappan Muthu, signing off

Shahid Afridi is Man of the Match "I tried my level best to perform well. Misbah has great support and it's my type of situation and I had the licence. I was confident that 10, 10.5 an over was possibly so I took a chance. I have to congratulate Bangladesh for the score they put up. We need to do better with the ball. [Who is your batting coach] None, no one. Moin bhai supports me. I knew if I slog I will hit it because it was a very good pitch"

"He's really playing well and he's cashing into his form which is really good for us," says Misbah-ul-Haq. "Everybody knows the kind of players he is when he is in full swing and nobody can stop him. That's really encouraging, we've been playing well in chases and this will give us great confidence in the coming games and years also. We have been playing a lot of cricket here and when the ball starts going, you can't stop it. We have a world class bowling attack and even they couldn't stop it so we knew we can score 10 an over if needed. We have quite a few things in our mind. We don't want to lose the game 260 was also in our mind and we had to distribute our batsmen and that's why we changed the line-up

10.05 pm Time for the presentation. Mushfiqur Rahim says he thought after the last couple of games, we got a good start from the openers and we finished the batting well too. But when Afridi plays like that, he hit our best bowler, Shakib for three sixes in an over, there was very little we can do. They were hoping for a mis-hit and unfortunately he dropped one but thankfully he was out soon after. We bowled a few length balls at the wrong time but overall we played much better than the last few games and we can take a lot of positives from this game

10.00 pm Bangladesh will feel terribly aggrieved at not pulling this off. Their innings was also very similar in the afternoon. A solid ton from Anamul and rampant blitzes from Mushfiqur Rahim and Shakib Al Hasan took them to their highest score in ODIs. Things were looking quite good for them with the ball as well with their spinners stifling the scoring for the early part of the game. But against Shahid Afridi in that kind of form, there was very little the hosts could do

9.56 pm Umar Akmal pays tribute to Shahid Afridi by pulling out hte "star man" post. What a run chase and best of all, now no one can come and say Pakistan have no longer chased anything more than 250. It was set up by Ahmed Shehzad, who was admittedly rather slow, but he picked up the pace and completed an elegant century. And then came the whirlwing. Afridi smacked 59 off 25 balls, took the second-fastest fifty on ODIs and put Pakistan ahead. In between all that, Fawad Alam stayed composed in his comeback for Pakistan provided the foil for the destruction at the other end.

Alam thanks his family and friends. It is a big match. I'm playing for Pakistan after three and a half years. It's a big score but it was still chaseable, we thought. Bangaldesh batted well. The coach and captain said to keep wickets in hand and getting 10 runs an over is possible for us. Its my nature to play singles and doubles and my coach and captain always say dont go for a big hit and finish with singles. Then I spoke to Umar and I decided to go for it

dismissalText.commentary: Fawad Alam run out (†Anamul Haque/Al-Amin Hossain) 74 (70b 4x4 2x6 130m) SR: 105.71

commentPreTextItems.html: Tabrez: "You are a very one sided commentator just like ramiz raja.. Hauling praise only one team but completely ignoring the other" Technically, Bangladesh haven't had any answer in the last four overs, have they? Pakistan have made the play and they're on the brink

commentTextItems.html: 137 kph, Alam was backing away and the bowler bowls it short and slides it across him. Looks to ramp it over third man but doesn't connect. The keeper dribbles the ball through and the bowler breaks the stumps at the other end. There was lots of height on that bouncer though, very close to being a wide
opens the face and carves this length ball on off stump to the sweeper in the deep
races down the track to whack this length ball to the next city. Made too much room to connect and Alam walks up to calm his partner down. Only three needed after all, no need for such rash strokes

commentPreTextItems.html: Three runs to get to seal a spot in the final. Alam is getting a little attention after he fell on his face while completing that second run. A banner from the crowd proclaims, "Tigers, we are still with you"

commentTextItems.html: back of a length and just outside off, guided to point.
nudged to deep square leg and he is strong enough to run two again. There's been so many things impressive about this innings from Alam and his ability to convert ones into twos is chief among them.

commentPreTextItems.html: More prayers sent upstairs by the fans

commentTextItems.html: flighted and it dips on middle, Akmal sweeps to deep square leg
cut away to point as this is a length ball on off stump. Akmal is too quick and the single is completed quite comfortably
flighted on middle as he presses forward to block into the covers and race across for a single
smashed over cover! This was a loopy delivery outside off and Akmal stays leg side of it and slaps it inside out to the boundary

commentPreTextItems.html: 13 from 12 as there is another mini-conference among the Bangladeshis
ripon: "poor captaincy by mushi, he should try even one over to ziaur, remember ziaur is not a par-timer bowler he is a main bowl after all" Shakib again. Can he pull this off?

commentTextItems.html: almost a yorker on middle and leg, Alam opens the face towards cover for an easy single
low full toss on off stump, Akmal whips it and bisects long-on and deep midwicket for a couple. Gorgeous placement

commentTextItems.html: full toss on off stump, slashed to cover who misfields. Alam dives to make his ground at the other end. Desperate stuff
another one! This one goes into the Pakistan team in the dug out! That's Alam's highest score. Length ball on middle and he's heaved this over midwicket. The third six of his ODI career
speared in on leg stump and this has been worked to long leg

commentPreTextItems.html: MM-usa: "Oh Afridi, if only you were younger!"

commentTextItems.html: in the slot and he's mauled this over wide long-on! Full on middle, he gets under it after clearing his front leg and wallops it over the rope

commentPreTextItems.html: Waseem Abbas: "I always struggled to understand what the phrase, an injured lion is more dangerous, means. I am very clear now ... a blinder from Lala again !!!" Razzak's been brought on

commentTextItems.html: flighted on leg stump, nudged to long-on for a single

commentPreTextItems.html: Akmal, the new batsman, gets some advice from Afridi. Phew, what an innings! 33 needed off 19 balls.

commentTextItems.html: charges down the track to meet this on the full and carves this to the sweeper. Two taken

commentTextItems.html: length ball outside off, Afridi moves outside off and scoops it over the fine leg boundary! he's wobbling out there but it seems even an injured Afridi has what it takes to send the ball over the boundary!

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Hafeez c Imrul Kayes b Mominul Haque 52 (55b 8x4 0x6 77m) SR: 94.54

dismissalComment.html: it was on the cards. Pakistan were piling too much pressure on themselves and Hafeez goes for a slog-sweep against the spin. But all he manages is a slice to long-on. Tight lines from Mominul as he attacks middle and leg, Hafeez had planted his front leg out of the way and swings, but doesn't make good enough contact

dismissalText.commentary: Misbah-ul-Haq b Shakib Al Hasan 4 (4b 1x4 0x6 4m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Misbah's gone! Goes for an almighty heave over midwicket and he has been cleaned up. Bangladesh are ecstatic. What a good move by Mushi to bring back his strike bowler and Shakib does not disappoint. This is a skidder tossed up on off stump and Misbah has played all around it

dismissalText.commentary: Sohaib Maqsood c †Anamul Haque b Mominul Haque 2 (5b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: two wickets in two overs, Mirpur has gone haywire and that's nothing compared to what the Bangladesh players are feeling! Amid all that, Maqsood has not touched this ball! This quicker delivery just outside off bounces and turns a bit too much for the cut shot and beats him completely. The keeper goes up straight away and Umpire Llong agrees. Maqsood just has a wry smile on his face as he takes it on the chin and walks off

dismissalText.commentary: Fawad Alam run out (†Anamul Haque/Al-Amin Hossain) 74 (70b 4x4 2x6 130m) SR: 105.71

dismissalComment.html: 137 kph, Alam was backing away and the bowler bowls it short and slides it across him. Looks to ramp it over third man but doesn't connect. The keeper dribbles the ball through and the bowler breaks the stumps at the other end. There was lots of height on that bouncer though, very close to being a wide

series.name: Asia Cup
series.description: Afghanistan, Bangladesh, India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka in Bangladesh

seriesStandings.notes:
Preliminary Matches Win, with bonus point - 5
Win, without bonus point - 4
Tie or No Result - 2
Loss - 0 In the event of teams finishing on equal points, the right to play in the final match or series will be determined as follows:
  • The team with the most number of wins
  • If still equal, the team with the most number of wins over the other team(s) who are equal on points and have the same number of wins
  • If still equal, the team with the highest number of bonus points
  • If still equal, the team with the highest net run rate
In a match declared as no result, run rate is not applicable. Net Run Rate A team's net run rate is calculated by deducting from the average runs per over scored by that team throughout the competition, the average runs per over scored against that team throughout the competition. In the event of a team being all out in less than its full quota of overs, the calculation of its net run rate shall be based on the full quota of overs to which it would have been entitled and not on the number of overs in which the team was dismissed. Only those matches where results are achieved will count for the purpose of net run rate calculations. Where a match is abandoned, but a result is achieved under Duckworth/Lewis, for net run rate purposes Team 1 will be accredited with Team 2's Par Score on abandonment off the same number of overs faced by Team 2. Where a match is concluded but with Duckworth/Lewis having been applied at an earlier point in the match, Team 1 will be accredited with 1 run less than the final Target Score for Team 2 off the total number of overs allocated to Team 2 to reach the target. Bonus Points The team that achieves a run rate of 1.25 times that of the opposition shall be awarded one bonus point. A team's run rate will be calculated by reference to the runs scored in an innings divided by the number of overs faced. refer to Appendix 6 Final Match or Series If no result is achieved in a final the match shall be declared drawn. In the event of a drawn final, the teams will be declared as Joint Champion and the prize money will be shared equally between the two competing teams.

recentReportStory.title: Sensational Afridi seals final berth
recentReportStory.subTitle: Bangladesh v Pakistan, Asia Cup, Mirpur
recentReportStory.summary: Ahmed Shehzad's fifth ODI century set it up, but Pakistan needed special innings from Fawad Alam and Shahid Afridi to pull off their highest chase in ODIs and book a place in the Asia Cup final, against Sri Lanka

image.caption: Shahid Afridi goes over the top
image.longCaption: Shahid Afridi goes over the top, Bangladesh v Pakistan, Asia Cup, Mirpur, March 4, 2014

recentReportStory.credit: Mohammad Isam is ESPNcricinfo's Bangladesh correspondent. He tweets here

recentPreviewStory.title: Bangladesh look to Shakib for turnaround
recentPreviewStory.subTitle: Bangladesh v Pakistan, Asia Cup, Mirpur
recentPreviewStory.seoTitle: Bangladesh look to Shakib for turnaround
recentPreviewStory.summary: Pakistan's one-wicket win against India has put them in a strong position. A victory against Bangladesh on Wednesday will seal their place in the Asia Cup final

image.caption: Shakib Al Hasan picked up a couple of quick wickets
image.longCaption: Shakib Al Hasan picked up a couple of quick wickets, Bangladesh v Sri Lanka, 1st T20, Chittagong, February 12, 2014

recentPreviewStory.credit: Mohammad Isam is ESPNcricinfo's Bangladesh correspondent. He tweets here

video.title: Agarkar: Tall task for Bangladesh
video.subTitle: Bangladesh v Pakistan, Asia Cup, Mirpur
video.summary: Bangladesh take on Pakistan in a match that could see Bangladesh knocked out and Pakistan cement their place in the Asia Cup final alongside Sri Lanka
